name: (nf-core) fetchngs
description: Pipeline to fetch metadata and raw FastQ files from public databases (see https://nf-co.re/fetchngs)

input.help: File containing SRA/ENA/DDBJ/GEO identifiers one per line to download their associated metadata and FastQ files.

input_type.help: Specifies the type of identifier provided via `--input` - available options are 'sra' and 'synapse'.

nf_core_pipeline.help:
Name of supported nf-core pipeline (e.g. 'rnaseq').
  A samplesheet for direct use with the pipeline will be created with the appropriate columns.

force_sratools_download.help: Force download FastQ files via sra-tools instead of via the ENA FTP.

skip_fastq_download.help: Only download metadata for public data database ids and don't download the FastQ files.

max_cpus.help:
Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
  Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.help:
Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
  Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.help:
Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
  Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

publish_dir_mode.help:
Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
  The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

validate_params.help: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

workflow_repo.help: Workflow to run (identified by repository location)
